Identifiers and locators.Name: Pulsar name.  The B name if exists, otherwise the J name.
Identifiers and locators.JName: Pulsar name based on J2000 coordinates
Identifiers and locators.PMRA: Proper motion in the right ascension direction (mas/yr)
Identifiers and locators.PosEpoch: Epoch of position, defaults to PEpoch (MJD)
Identifiers and locators.PMElong: Proper motion in the ecliptic longitude direction (mas/yr)

Timing solution and profile parameters.F1: Time derivative of barycentric rotation frequency (s-2)
Timing solution and profile parameters.F2: Second time derivative of barycentric rotation frequency (s-3)
Timing solution and profile parameters.F3: Third time derivative of barycentric rotation frequency (s-4)
Timing solution and profile parameters.DM1: First time derivative of dispersion measure (cm-3 pc yr-1)
Timing solution and profile parameters.W50: Width of pulse at 50% of peak (ms). Note, pulse widths are a function of both observing frequency and observational time resolution,so quoted widths are indicative only. Refer to the original reference for details.
Timing solution and profile parameters.W10: Width of pulse at 10% (ms). Note the comments above for W50.
Timing solution and profile parameters.Units: Timescale for period/frequency and epoch data: TCB or TDB. See Hobbs, Edwards & Manchester (2006) for a discussion of the relationship between TCB and TDB.
Timing solution and profile parameters.Tau_sc: Temporal broadening of pulses at 1 GHz due to interstellar scattering (s). Note: values measured at other frequencies are scaled assuming Tau_sc ~ nu^{-4.4}.
Timing solution and profile parameters.CLK: Reference clock used for timing solution
Timing solution and profile parameters.EPHEM: Solar-system ephemeris used for timing solution
Timing solution and profile parameters.F4: Fourth time derivative of barycentric rotation frequency (s^-5)
Timing solution and profile parameters.F5: Fifth time derivative of barycentric rotation frequency (s^-6)
Timing solution and profile parameters.F6: Sixth time derivative of barycentric rotation frequency (s^-7)
Timing solution and profile parameters.F7: Seventh time derivative of barycentric rotation frequency (s^-8)
Timing solution and profile parameters.F8: Eighth time derivative of barycentric rotation frequency (s^-9)
Timing solution and profile parameters.F9: Ninth time derivative of barycentric rotation frequency (s^-10)
Timing solution and profile parameters.DMEpoch: Reference epoch for DM, defaults to PEpoch (MJD)
Timing solution and profile parameters.DM2: Second time derivative of dispersion measure (cm-3pc yr-2)
Timing solution and profile parameters.DM3: Third time derivative of dispersion measure (cm-3pc yr-3)
Timing solution and profile parameters.DM4: Fourth time derivative of dispersion measure (cm-3pc yr-4)
Timing solution and profile parameters.DM5: Fifth time derivative of dispersion measure (cm-3pc yr-5)
Timing solution and profile parameters.DM6: Sixth time derivative of dispersion measure (cm-3pc yr-6)
Timing solution and profile parameters.DM7: Seventh time derivative of dispersion measure (cm-3pc yr-7)
Timing solution and profile parameters.DM8: Eighth time derivative of dispersion measure (cm-3pc yr-8)
Timing solution and profile parameters.DM9: Ninth time derivative of dispersion measure (cm-3pc yr-9)

Binary system parameters.Binary: Binary model (usually one of several recognised by the pulsar timing programs TEMPO or TEMPO2). Modified versions of standard models are often used - refer to the source paper for details of the binary model used.
Binary system parameters.A1: Projected semi-major axis of orbit (lt s)
Binary system parameters.TASC: Epoch of ascending node(MJD) - ELL1 binary model
Binary system parameters.EPS1: ECC x sin(OM) - ELL1 binary model
Binary system parameters.EPS2: ECC x cos(OM) - ELL1 binary model
Binary system parameters.MinMass: Minimum companion mass assuming i=90 degrees and neutron star mass is 1.35 Mo
Binary system parameters.MedMass: Median companion mass assuming i=60 degrees
Binary system parameters.FB1: 1st time derivative of orbital frequency (Hz s^-1)
Binary system parameters.FB2: 2nd time derivative of orbital frequency (Hz s^-2)
Binary system parameters.OMDOT: 1st time derivative of periastron longitude (periastron advance) (deg yr^-1)
Binary system parameters.OM2DOT: 2nd time derivative of periastron longitude (deg yr^-2)
Binary system parameters.A1DOT: 1st time derivative of projected semi-major axis (lt-s s^-1)
Binary system parameters.A12DOT: 2nd time derivative of projected semi-major axis (lt-s s^-2)
Binary system parameters.T0_2: Epoch of periastron [2nd orbit (where innermost orbit is 1st)] (MJD)
Binary system parameters.A1_2: Projected semi-major axis of orbit [2nd orbit] (s)
Binary system parameters.PBDOT_2: 1st time derivative of binary period [2nd orbit]
Binary system parameters.A1_3: Projected semi-major axis of orbit [3rd orbit] (s)
Binary system parameters.PBDOT_3: 1st time derivative of binary period [3rd orbit]
Binary system parameters.XPBDOT: Rate of change of orbital period minus GR prediction
Binary system parameters.KOM: Long. on sky of asc. node (N toward E) from ann. orbital parallax  (deg)
Binary system parameters.KIN: Orbit inclination from annual orbital parallax  (deg)
Binary system parameters.MASS_Q_2: Mass ratio for 2nd binary companion: M1/M2_2
Binary system parameters.OM_ASC: Longitude on sky of ascending node (from N toward E) (deg)
Binary system parameters.OM_ASC_2: Longitude on sky of ascending node (2nd orbit) (deg)
Binary system parameters.XOMDOT: Rate of periastron advance minus GR prediction (deg/yr)
Binary system parameters.H3: Amplitude of 3rd Shapiro-delay harmonic (s). See Freire & Wex (2010) for a discussion of H3, H4 and STIG and how these relate to the Shapiro delay parameters r (or M2) and s (or SINI)
Binary system parameters.STIG: Ratio of successive Shapiro-delay harmonics (e.g., H4/H3)
Binary system parameters.UPRMASS: 90% confidence upper companion mass limit, i=26deg (solar mass)
Binary system parameters.MINOMDOT: Minimum omega dot, assuming sin i = 1 and M_ns = 1.4Mo (deg/yr)

Distance parameters.Dist: Best estimate of the pulsar distance using the YMW16 DM-based distance as default (kpc)
Distance parameters.Dist_DM: Distance based on the YMW16 electron density model. In 'LONG' or 'PUBLICATION QUALITY' modes, lower limits from the distance model are preceded by a '+' sign.
Distance parameters.ZZ: Distance from the Galactic plane, based on Dist
Distance parameters.XX: X-Distance in X-Y-Z Galactic coordinate system (kpc)
Distance parameters.YY: Y-Distance in X-Y-Z Galactic coordinate system (kpc)
Distance parameters.Dist1: Best estimate of the pulsar distance using the NE2001 DM-based distance as default (kpc)
Distance parameters.Dist_AMN: Lower limit on independent distance estimate (kpc)
Distance parameters.Dist_AMX: Upper limit on independent distance estimate (kpc)
Distance parameters.Dist_A: Independent distance estimate - takes precedence over other distance estimates for DIST and DIST1 (kpc)

Associations and survey parameters.Assoc: Names of other objects, e.g., supernova remnant, globular cluster or gamma-ray source associated with the pulsar
Associations and survey parameters.Survey: Surveys that detected the pulsar (discovery survey first).
Associations and survey parameters.OSurvey: Surveys that detected the pulsar encoded as bits in integer
Associations and survey parameters.NGlt: Number of glitches observed for the pulsar
Associations and survey parameters.GLF0: Permanent pulse frequency increment at glitch
Associations and survey parameters.GLFI: Permanent frequency derivative increment at glitch
Associations and survey parameters.GLTD: Time constant for decaying frequency increment

Derived parameters.P1_i: Period derivative corrected for Shklovskii (proper motion) effect
